title: If boards are a minor % of the whole LoL community, why not use the client itself?
body:
I mean, and with this i DO NOT want to bring up discussions like revert lb or anything else, why not use the client to make surveys across all the servers so that Riot can reach out all the community of LoL?
Sometimes, but rarely, Riot did surveys on the client for major things like "how do you feel about the new runes?". So i wanted to ask, why not use this useful yet simple tool more frequently to get opinions on many other questions such as reworks, skins, lore, music, art, esports etc.? 
In my opinion, the client is the only and true way to gather those who really care about the game just because they have to use the client to play, am i wrong?
So that people from reddit or other social platforms do not have to bring up crusades or things like that just to represent an opinion that from that portion of the community care about and thinks that it needs to be discussed.
To bring up this suggestion in a fair way, i must explain its cons which could be:

- The survey system could be too invasive and may annoy people that are casual players who don't really care about if Swain tranforms into a parrot of a crow but actually want to have some fun without even thinking too deeply into the game mechanics.

- The survey system could be abused or biased by people themselves: "oh yeah streamer X said that champion Y isn't good right now so i blindly trust him and will vote on the next survey so that this champion can get Z change". By this i mean people who vote X because many others voted the same answer, in this way people might lose their own perception of the problem examined and will answer mindlessly without even putting a reason behind their choice which could ruin in a not intended way the game itself.

If this whole thing was already discussed somewhere or even several times, i'm sorry, didn't mean to make a spam topic and feel free to ignore this. If not, please, i want to hear your thoughts, especially from rioters.

Thanks for reading.

replies.body: They already do use the client homepage to roll out anonymous surveys from time to time. I've taken several of them. In these surveys they ask about things like the rate new champions are released, game balance, player behavior, etc etc. They also give you an opportunity to write in your own thoughts on whatever you want.

Yeah but as i said, they use surveys for things of a much larger scope than simply questions about single champions. It is good they actually use surveys that way, better if the would use them for many other things too!

We do smaller surveys too! Single champion surveys are actually quite common, especially if it's someone we just reworked or something similar.

We actually run a LOT of surveys on a variety of topics (because as you say all players come to the client), but we spread them out between a lot of players. As an individual player you're unlikely to get a ton of survey questions in a row, more like one every once in a while.

lawl its weird because the only survey i got is from a game and they were asking if the experience was enjoyable . I would gladly take any survey on serious topic like how do you like the new rune system or does the game are too short or too long , etc . I mean if you want real feedback from your playerbase it would be much appreciated or youre just too scare of the truth . {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}} {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
We fielded surveys on those exact two topics over the break and are looking at results this week.

These surveys are inherently flawed because they miss the people who are the most against the current state, IE the people who have quit because of shitty short games and would come back if games are longer.

We also frequently field surveys to players that have churned from the game, ask them why, what would bring them back etc. We also track things like average games played per login session, total game hours around the world, active players etc. We look at a far bigger picture than just the subjective data from surveys - it's also about objective data. If we saw that less League was being played, and there were fewer players now than there were 2 months ago, you can bet we'd be diving in to figure out why.

> We also frequently field surveys to players that have churned from the game

What's the response rate and delay on those? I can't imagine its high if they've already been fed up enough to leave, and if you ask me why i quit a game several months ago and i actually take the time to respond i probably couldn't give you an honest or meaningful answer from memory. In fact over time my answer would probably have changed because if it was a game I enjoyed at one point then my brain wouldn't want to place blame on the game I loved, instead making up a reason that seems more justified in hindsight. If i look through my steam library i can find several of these where when i think about it i quit the game for valid technical or design reasons at the time, but i still look at them from time to time and go "why did i quit that game?". It takes me some time to get over the fact that the game wasn't as great as i remember it. It had flaws, even if i convinced myself that i quit for other reasons. 

(The games i'm thinking about as i type this is Civ 2-5 if you're curious.)
you did it in the client ? because i didnt receive it . I just receive a survery about if this game had was a good experience .

Just because they had one doesnt mean you got it. If i had to guess they probably have repeating surveys LIKE "player experience" that happen every patch. And specific ones that happen whenever something major happens.

Thank you for your reply, really appreciated. My problem is that "once in a while", for instance, i also main lb but i never received the survey and i wanted so much to participate to give my feedback. When talking about lb rework i always feel reluctant to post on boards because people tend to prejudge the topic and downvote making the topic sink in the abyss of the boards passing unviewed. 
But lets not go further in that direction.
What i mean is that i think surveys should be "open", not selected by riot, not totally i mean. Riot should choose the question to discuss through surveys and people can choose to join the survey or not. Hope this is constructive feedback for you guys!
Thank you for your amazing work with LoL!

That's not how to get a significant survey though. You **have** to be selective to ensure your survey population is as representative of the whole as possible. It wouldn't be a valid statistical sample if they sent it only to all LB mains, or even if they sent it mostly to LB mains (unless their question is "how do LB mains feel about X").

Further, if you give people the choice to join or not, then they would suffer from response bias - i.e. they'd get a ton of extreme responses as extreme opinions are more likely to be willing to answer a survey about it. If it's a few question long in-client survey that pops up on the side, people from *all* opinions are more likely (but not guaranteed) to answer - giving a more valid representation of the opinion of the community as a whole.

When making big changes Riot considers the game as a whole - including players from all walks. The surveys they conduct will be representative of this - including players from all walks.

Good answer, and all true. We do have surveys and/or lab sessions when we want the opinion of folks who main a champion specifically (before/after a rework for example) but when we want a slice that's representative of the whole League community we generally survey more broadly. 

And yes, it's possible to play League and not get a survey Q very often or at all. We do run surveys in all regions though. :)

Can I ask why not surveying every account? (or every 30+ account, or every account that plays ranked, or every account that played X games on that particular patch or on that particular champion.. you got me). And btw I was still expecting a reply to you from the thread where you replied to those calling you names and I made a wall of text ignored {{sticker:cass-cry}}  I'm sad now

Heya! I read your comments on runes & paths a while back, but I wasn't sure what to respond beyond thank you for taking the time to write up your thoughts. It was not ignored, trust me. :) 

Also I think we would get a lot of burnout if we asked everyone everything - folks would probably start ignoring survey questions or treating them differently if they were really common (which would have an effect on results for sure).

Honestly I get a little burntout when I take the surveys more than once because I get asked a lot of the same questions (What’s your account level? Would you recommend the game? Do you play ranked?)

I would be more inclinded to take the surveys if they didn’t ask me the same generalistic questions every time (especially when the answer can be determined automatically, like account level). Maybe keeping the surveys a bit longer helps weed out people who would troll the system, but it’s a little annoying when all I want to do is provided a little feedback on recent changes to the game.

Thanks for taking the time to keep us informed Sparkle!

I see some of you rioters are keeping an eye on this topic, very glad to see this.
Back to discussion.
It's ok if surveys aren't super frequent but at the actual rate (at least for me in EUW) it's pretty rare to get a survey. I think you should increase a bit more this frequency, not by too much, but enough.
Thanks for the interest again on this topic.

Well.. I wanted to know what you thought about it and if it's a thing you at Riot had considered (since you were discussing that argument I suppose you are informed about it), and if it had particular cons I failed to consider or simply was a matter of taste/easier to balance as I suspect.

Back to the topic, maybe you have a point.. but what letting the players request the perma-survey thing then? Think of it like PBE: one had to specifically request an account and have their request approved to help with testing and pre-game feedback, you could allow us to help you giving permanent feedback to the current game in every topic needed. 

Also, I feel RNG behind surveys can skew results as well.. for example I got a survey about Evelyn, which I completed the best I could and expressing what I would have liked her to become, her strengths etc.. But I am not even a jungle player and I was not playing Evelyn from a huge amount of time, and, no matter how good the rework would have been, I would have not be interested in seriously picking her up again cause my roles were stable. Had that particular survey be directed to an Eve main it would have certainly be more productive then on me! (And I will be {{sticker:sg-shisa}}  if I happened to get the one for Eve but when the time comes miss the one for Morgana, one of my most played and favourite champions).
 
PS: Keep staying with us, even when we are in disagreement communication (real communication, from you guys using normal worlds and explaining your position not the "everything is flowers" kind of communication that comes out sometimes)  makes all things feel better/more ok  even when we don't like them. "Veterans loosing ip on runes" "guys we need the income from selling champion" is totally alright in my book. Not going to have my IP back but I feel ok not being lied to or told "is better for you" when I feel it is not.  Well, made a WoT again in bad English :p Thanks for your time ~~and I hope the ones flaming you and discouraging comms when you actually open it will all step on a lego.
~~
